content.raw: Should the name of the service used to control the lights exposed as a parameter and documented here?
content.html: Should the name of the service used to control the lights exposed as a parameter and documented here?

content.raw:
Yeah, I will document it. The name of the service is “light\_control” in default but it can also be overridden by a plugin parameter <main\_switch\_srvs> so each model has its own service name to turn on/off its lights attached on it. For example, a robot has two flashlights and a user can do like “rosservice call /flashlight1 true” and “rosservice call /flashlight2 false”  
Would it be a good idea if I define this default service name in CommonTypes.hh?
content.html:
Yeah, I will document it. The name of the service is “light_control” in default but it can also be overridden by a plugin parameter <main_switch_srvs> so each model has its own service name to turn on/off its lights attached on it. For example, a robot has two flashlights and a user can do like “rosservice call /flashlight1 true” and “rosservice call /flashlight2 false”
Would it be a good idea if I define this default service name in CommonTypes.hh?
